title: Elemental
data:
The **elemental** is a [monster class](/wiki/Monster_class "Monster class") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*, and is represented by the uppercase [E](/wiki/E "E") glyph (E). Elementals are designated internally by the macro `S_ELEMENTAL`.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

The monster class contains the following monsters:[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

- E [stalker](/wiki/Stalker "Stalker")
- E [air elemental](/wiki/Air_elemental "Air elemental")
- E [earth elemental](/wiki/Earth_elemental "Earth elemental")
- E [fire elemental](/wiki/Fire_elemental "Fire elemental")
- E [water elemental](/wiki/Water_elemental "Water elemental")

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Common traits](#Common_traits)
  - [1.1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 History](#History)

- [3 Variants](#Variants)

  - [3.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [3.2 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [3.3 SpliceHack](#SpliceHack)
  - [3.4 EvilHack](#EvilHack)
  - [3.5 SlashTHEM](#SlashTHEM)

- [4 Encyclopedia entry](#Encyclopedia_entry)

- [5 References](#References)

## Common traits

All elementals are [strong](/wiki/Strong "Strong"), [inediate](/wiki/Inediate "Inediate") and [neutral](/wiki/Neutral "Neutral")-aligned monsters that lack a sense of [smell](/wiki/Smell "Smell"). Except for the stalker, they are [eyeless](/wiki/Eyeless "Eyeless"), [mindless](/wiki/Mindless "Mindless") and amorphous - they also possess an [MR score](/wiki/Magic_resistance_\(monster\) "Magic resistance (monster)") of 30.

### Generation

Excluding the stalker, each of the elementals has a corresponding [Elemental Plane](/wiki/Elemental_Plane "Elemental Plane") that is considered their 'home plane': several elementals are generated on their home plane at level creation, all elementals generated within the level will have three times the normal amount of hit points, and their maximum HP-gain threshold is also multiplied by 3.[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)[\[4\]](#cite_note-4)[\[5\]](#cite_note-5)

The elemental is the first [quest](/wiki/Quest "Quest") monster class for [Monks](/wiki/Monk "Monk"), and makes up 24⁄175 of the monsters randomly generated on the [Monk quest](/wiki/Monk_quest "Monk quest"). Some elementals are also generated on floors below the home level of the quest branch at level creation: three are generated on the upper filler level, and two each are generated on the lower filler level(s). The elemental is also the second quest monster class for [Samurai](/wiki/Samurai "Samurai"), making up 6⁄175 of the monsters randomly generated on the [Samurai quest](/wiki/Samurai_quest "Samurai quest").

2 to 3 elementals appear among the monsters generated in the central room of the [Castle](/wiki/Castle "Castle") at level creation.

Minus the stalker, elementals [do not leave behind](/wiki/Corpseless "Corpseless") [corpses](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse") upon death.

## History

The elemental monster class is introduced in [NetHack 3.0.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.0 "NetHack 3.0.0") with the exception of the stalker. While the stalker first appears in Hack for PDP-11, which is based on [Jay Fenlason's Hack](/wiki/Jay_Fenlason%27s_Hack "Jay Fenlason's Hack"), [NetHack 3.3.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.3.0 "NetHack 3.3.0") is the first version to move the stalker to the elemental class, and repurposes its former I glyph to indicate the last known position of any [invisible](/wiki/Invisible "Invisible") monster.

## Variants

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), at least one elemental of each type is generated on a specific square within the Cloud Bank of the [Lawful Quest](/wiki/Lawful_Quest "Lawful Quest") at level creation, with a 3⁄5 chance of a second one of that type being placed nearby - four other random elementals are placed as well.

The elemental is the first quest monster class for [Flame Mages](/wiki/Flame_Mage "Flame Mage"), and makes up 24⁄175 of the monsters randomly generated on the [Flame Mage quest](/wiki/Flame_Mage_quest "Flame Mage quest").

### dNetHack

[dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") adds many new monsters to the monster class:

- E [furious whirlwind](/wiki/Furious_whirlwind "Furious whirlwind")
- E [ancient tempest](/wiki/Ancient_tempest "Ancient tempest")
- E [dream quasielemental](/wiki/Dream_quasielemental "Dream quasielemental")
- E [lightning paraelemental](/wiki/Lightning_paraelemental "Lightning paraelemental")
- E [poison paraelemental](/wiki/Poison_paraelemental "Poison paraelemental")
- E [ice paraelemental](/wiki/Ice_paraelemental "Ice paraelemental")
- E [acid paraelemental](/wiki/Acid_paraelemental "Acid paraelemental")
- E [terracotta soldier](/index.php?title=Terracotta_soldier\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Terracotta soldier (page does not exist)")
- E [lethe elemental](/wiki/Lethe_elemental "Lethe elemental")
- E [mortai](/wiki/Mortai "Mortai")
- E [ford guardian](/index.php?title=Ford_guardian\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Ford guardian (page does not exist)")

[Half-dragon](/wiki/Half-dragon_\(starting_race\) "Half-dragon (starting race)") [Bards](/wiki/Bard "Bard") that reach [experience level](/wiki/Experience_level "Experience level") 14 can [sing elementals into being](/wiki/Bard#Sing_an_Elemental_into_being "Bard").

[Pentagrams](/wiki/User:Chris/dNetHack/Pentagram "User:Chris/dNetHack/Pentagram") and the [Elder Elemental Eye](/wiki/User:Chris/dNetHack/Elder_Elemental_Eye "User:Chris/dNetHack/Elder Elemental Eye") are [wards](/wiki/Ward_\(dNetHack\) "Ward (dNetHack)") that can protect a character against elementals at all levels of reinforcement.

The Nurturing [Word of Creation](/wiki/Word_of_Creation "Word of Creation")'s active power deals (XL⁄2)d12 damage to elementals and other specific monsters.

### SpliceHack

- *Main articles: [Elemental (SpliceHack)](/wiki/Elemental_\(SpliceHack\) "Elemental (SpliceHack)") and [scroll of elementalism](/wiki/Scroll_of_elementalism "Scroll of elementalism")*

[SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack") introduces several new monsters to the monster class:

- E [mud elemental](/wiki/Mud_elemental "Mud elemental")
- E [acid elemental](/wiki/Acid_elemental "Acid elemental")
- E [ice elemental](/wiki/Ice_elemental "Ice elemental")
- E [magma elemental](/wiki/Magma_elemental "Magma elemental")
- E [plasma elemental](/wiki/Plasma_elemental "Plasma elemental")
- E [fusion elemental](/wiki/Fusion_elemental "Fusion elemental")

SpliceHack also adds the [scroll of elementalism](/wiki/Scroll_of_elementalism "Scroll of elementalism"), which can summon a random elemental.

### EvilHack

In [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), each non-stalker elemental now has a form of engulfing attack.

### SlashTHEM

In addition to SLASH'EM details, [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM") adds the following monsters to the monster class:

- E [ice elemental](/wiki/Ice_elemental "Ice elemental")
- E [greater air elemental](/index.php?title=Greater_air_elemental\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Greater air elemental (page does not exist)")
- E [greater earth elemental](/index.php?title=Greater_earth_elemental\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Greater earth elemental (page does not exist)")
- E [greater fire elemental](/index.php?title=Greater_fire_elemental\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Greater fire elemental (page does not exist)")
- E [greater water elemental](/index.php?title=Greater_water_elemental\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Greater water elemental (page does not exist)")

The four elementals from *NetHack* cannot [grow up](/wiki/Grow_up "Grow up") into their "greater" counterparts.

Each set of elementals has a [quest artifact](/wiki/Quest_artifact "Quest artifact") that can be [invoked](/wiki/Invoked "Invoked") to summon a tame elemental, including the artifacts carried over from SLASH'EM:

- The [Flame Mage](/wiki/Flame_Mage "Flame Mage") quest artifact, [The Candle of Eternal Flame](/wiki/The_Candle_of_Eternal_Flame "The Candle of Eternal Flame"), for fire elementals
- The [Ice Mage](/wiki/Ice_Mage "Ice Mage") quest artifact, [The Storm Whistle](/wiki/The_Storm_Whistle "The Storm Whistle"), for ice elementals (changed from SLASH'EM)
- The [Electric Mage](/wiki/Electric_Mage "Electric Mage") quest artifact, [The Harp of Lightning](/index.php?title=The_Harp_of_Lightning\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "The Harp of Lightning (page does not exist)"), for air elementals
- The [Acid Mage](/wiki/Acid_Mage "Acid Mage") quest artifact, [The Flute of Slime](/index.php?title=The_Flute_of_Slime\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "The Flute of Slime (page does not exist)"), for earth elementals
- The [Firefighter](/wiki/Firefighter "Firefighter") quest artifact, the [Fire Chief Helmet](/wiki/Fire_Chief_Helmet "Fire Chief Helmet"), for water elementals

The invoke effects for the Acid and Electric Mage quest artifacts are based on the associations between particular elements in *[Dungeons & Dragons](/wiki/Dungeons_%26_Dragons "Dungeons & Dragons")*.

Each invoke effect 3⁄4 chance of generating a standard elemental of that type and a 1⁄4 chance of generating a greater elemental - for The Storm Whistle, it instead has a 1⁄4 chance of creating an ice elemental, and will otherwise create an [ice vortex](/wiki/Ice_vortex "Ice vortex").

## Encyclopedia entry

Elementals are manifestations of the basic nature of the  
universe. There are four known forms of elementals: air, fire,  
water, and earth. Some mystics have postulated the necessity  
for a fifth type, the spirit elemental, but none have ever  
been encountered, at least on this plane of existence.

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [include/monsym.h in NetHack 3.6.7, line 45](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/include/monsym.h#L45)
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [src/monst.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1256](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/monst.c#L1256)
3. [↑](#cite_ref-3) [src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 37](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/makemon.c#L37): *elementals and home planes*
4. [↑](#cite_ref-4) [src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1012](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/makemon.c#L1012): *max HP for elementals on home planes*
5. [↑](#cite_ref-5) [src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1825](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/makemon.c#L1825): *max HP gain for elementals on home planes*

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.](/images/f/f7/Nh367-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.")
html:
Elemental

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search

The elemental is a monster class that appears in NetHack, and is represented by the uppercase E glyph (E). Elementals are designated internally by the macro S_ELEMENTAL.[1]

The monster class contains the following monsters:[2]

  • E stalker
  • E air elemental
  • E earth elemental
  • E fire elemental
  • E water elemental

Contents

  • 1 Common traits
    • 1.1 Generation
  • 2 History
  • 3 Variants
    • 3.1 SLASH'EM
    • 3.2 dNetHack
    • 3.3 SpliceHack
    • 3.4 EvilHack
    • 3.5 SlashTHEM
  • 4 Encyclopedia entry
  • 5 References

Common traits

All elementals are strong, inediate and neutral-aligned monsters that lack a sense of smell. Except for the stalker, they are eyeless, mindless and amorphous - they also possess an MR score of 30.

Generation

Excluding the stalker, each of the elementals has a corresponding Elemental Plane that is considered their 'home plane': several elementals are generated on their home plane at level creation, all elementals generated within the level will have three times the normal amount of hit points, and their maximum HP-gain threshold is also multiplied by 3.[3][4][5]

The elemental is the first quest monster class for Monks, and makes up 24⁄175 of the monsters randomly generated on the Monk quest. Some elementals are also generated on floors below the home level of the quest branch at level creation: three are generated on the upper filler level, and two each are generated on the lower filler level(s). The elemental is also the second quest monster class for Samurai, making up 6⁄175 of the monsters randomly generated on the Samurai quest.

2 to 3 elementals appear among the monsters generated in the central room of the Castle at level creation.

Minus the stalker, elementals do not leave behind corpses upon death.

History

The elemental monster class is introduced in NetHack 3.0.0 with the exception of the stalker. While the stalker first appears in Hack for PDP-11, which is based on Jay Fenlason's Hack, NetHack 3.3.0 is the first version to move the stalker to the elemental class, and repurposes its former I glyph to indicate the last known position of any invisible monster.

Variants

SLASH'EM

In SLASH'EM, at least one elemental of each type is generated on a specific square within the Cloud Bank of the Lawful Quest at level creation, with a 3⁄5 chance of a second one of that type being placed nearby - four other random elementals are placed as well.

The elemental is the first quest monster class for Flame Mages, and makes up 24⁄175 of the monsters randomly generated on the Flame Mage quest.

dNetHack

dNetHack adds many new monsters to the monster class:

  • E furious whirlwind
  • E ancient tempest
  • E dream quasielemental
  • E lightning paraelemental
  • E poison paraelemental
  • E ice paraelemental
  • E acid paraelemental
  • E terracotta soldier
  • E lethe elemental
  • E mortai
  • E ford guardian

Half-dragon Bards that reach experience level 14 can sing elementals into being.

Pentagrams and the Elder Elemental Eye are wards that can protect a character against elementals at all levels of reinforcement.

The Nurturing Word of Creation's active power deals (XL⁄2)d12 damage to elementals and other specific monsters.

SpliceHack

Main articles: Elemental (SpliceHack) and scroll of elementalism

SpliceHack introduces several new monsters to the monster class:

  • E mud elemental
  • E acid elemental
  • E ice elemental
  • E magma elemental
  • E plasma elemental
  • E fusion elemental

SpliceHack also adds the scroll of elementalism, which can summon a random elemental.

EvilHack

In EvilHack, each non-stalker elemental now has a form of engulfing attack.

SlashTHEM

In addition to SLASH'EM details, SlashTHEM adds the following monsters to the monster class:

  • E ice elemental
  • E greater air elemental
  • E greater earth elemental
  • E greater fire elemental
  • E greater water elemental

The four elementals from NetHack cannot grow up into their "greater" counterparts.

Each set of elementals has a quest artifact that can be invoked to summon a tame elemental, including the artifacts carried over from SLASH'EM:

  • The Flame Mage quest artifact, The Candle of Eternal Flame, for fire elementals
  • The Ice Mage quest artifact, The Storm Whistle, for ice elementals (changed from SLASH'EM)
  • The Electric Mage quest artifact, The Harp of Lightning, for air elementals
  • The Acid Mage quest artifact, The Flute of Slime, for earth elementals
  • The Firefighter quest artifact, the Fire Chief Helmet, for water elementals

The invoke effects for the Acid and Electric Mage quest artifacts are based on the associations between particular elements in Dungeons & Dragons.

Each invoke effect 3⁄4 chance of generating a standard elemental of that type and a 1⁄4 chance of generating a greater elemental - for The Storm Whistle, it instead has a 1⁄4 chance of creating an ice elemental, and will otherwise create an ice vortex.

Encyclopedia entry

Elementals are manifestations of the basic nature of the
universe. There are four known forms of elementals: air, fire,
water, and earth. Some mystics have postulated the necessity
for a fifth type, the spirit elemental, but none have ever
been encountered, at least on this plane of existence.


References

  1. ↑ include/monsym.h in NetHack 3.6.7, line 45
  2. ↑ src/monst.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1256
  3. ↑ src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 37: elementals and home planes
  4. ↑ src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1012: max HP for elementals on home planes
  5. ↑ src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1825: max HP gain for elementals on home planes

rawPage: The '''elemental''' is a [[monster class]] that appears in ''[[NetHack]]'', and is represented by the uppercase [[E]] glyph ({{white|E}}). Elementals are designated internally by the macro '''S_ELEMENTAL'''.{{refsrc|include/monsym.h|45|version=NetHack 3.6.7}} The monster class contains the following monsters:{{refsrc|src/monst.c|1256|version=NetHack 3.6.7}} * {{monsymlink|stalker}} * {{monsymlink|air elemental}} * {{monsymlink|earth elemental}} * {{monsymlink|fire elemental}} * {{monsymlink|water elemental}} ==Common traits== All elementals are [[strong]], [[inediate]] and [[neutral]]-aligned monsters that lack a sense of [[smell]]. Except for the stalker, they are [[eyeless]], [[mindless]] and amorphous - they also possess an [[Magic resistance (monster)|MR score]] of 30. ===Generation=== Excluding the stalker, each of the elementals has a corresponding [[Elemental Plane]] that is considered their 'home plane': several elementals are generated on their home plane at level creation, all elementals generated within the level will have three times the normal amount of hit points, and their maximum HP-gain threshold is also multiplied by 3.{{refsrc|src/makemon.c|37|version=NetHack 3.6.7|comment=elementals and home planes}}{{refsrc|src/makemon.c|1012|version=NetHack 3.6.7|comment=max HP for elementals on home planes}}{{refsrc|src/makemon.c|1825|version=NetHack 3.6.7|comment=max HP gain for elementals on home planes}} The elemental is the first [[quest]] monster class for [[Monk]]s, and makes up {{frac|24|175}} of the monsters randomly generated on the [[Monk quest]]. Some elementals are also generated on floors below the home level of the quest branch at level creation: three are generated on the upper filler level, and two each are generated on the lower filler level(s). The elemental is also the second quest monster class for [[Samurai]], making up {{frac|6|175}} of the monsters randomly generated on the [[Samurai quest]]. 2 to 3 elementals appear among the monsters generated in the central room of the [[Castle]] at level creation. Minus the stalker, elementals [[Corpseless|do not leave behind]] [[corpse]]s upon death. ==History== The elemental monster class is introduced in [[NetHack 3.0.0]] with the exception of the stalker. While the stalker first appears in Hack for PDP-11, which is based on [[Jay Fenlason's Hack]], [[NetHack 3.3.0]] is the first version to move the stalker to the elemental class, and repurposes its former {{white|I}} glyph to indicate the last known position of any [[invisible]] monster. ==Variants== ===SLASH'EM=== In [[SLASH'EM]], at least one elemental of each type is generated on a specific square within the Cloud Bank of the [[Lawful Quest]] at level creation, with a {{frac|3|5}} chance of a second one of that type being placed nearby - four other random elementals are placed as well. The elemental is the first quest monster class for [[Flame Mage]]s, and makes up {{frac|24|175}} of the monsters randomly generated on the [[Flame Mage quest]]. ===dNetHack=== [[dNetHack]] adds many new monsters to the monster class: * {{magenta|E}} [[furious whirlwind]] * {{magenta|E}} [[ancient tempest]] * {{brightgreen|E}} [[dream quasielemental]] * {{brightblue|E}} [[lightning paraelemental]] * {{brightmagenta|E}} [[poison paraelemental]] * {{brightcyan|E}} [[ice paraelemental]] * {{green|E}} [[acid paraelemental]] * {{brown|E}} [[terracotta soldier]] * {{gray|E}} [[lethe elemental]] * {{magenta|E}} [[mortai]] * {{blue|E}} [[ford guardian]] [[Half-dragon (starting race)|Half-dragon]] [[Bard]]s that reach [[experience level]] 14 can [[Bard#Sing an Elemental into being|sing elementals into being]]. [[User:Chris/dNetHack/Pentagram|Pentagrams]] and the [[User:Chris/dNetHack/Elder Elemental Eye|Elder Elemental Eye]] are [[Ward (dNetHack)|wards]] that can protect a character against elementals at all levels of reinforcement. The Nurturing [[Word of Creation]]'s active power deals ({{frac|XL|2}})d12 damage to elementals and other specific monsters. ===SpliceHack=== {{main|Elemental (SpliceHack)|scroll of elementalism}} [[SpliceHack]] introduces several new monsters to the monster class: * {{brown|E}} [[mud elemental]] * {{brightgreen|E}} [[acid elemental]] * {{white|E}} [[ice elemental]] * {{orange|E}} [[magma elemental]] * {{cyan|E}} [[plasma elemental]] * {{magenta|E}} [[fusion elemental]] SpliceHack also adds the [[scroll of elementalism]], which can summon a random elemental. ===EvilHack=== In [[EvilHack]], each non-stalker elemental now has a form of engulfing attack. ===SlashTHEM=== In addition to SLASH'EM details, [[SlashTHEM]] adds the following monsters to the monster class: * {{brightcyan|E}} [[ice elemental]] * {{black|E}} [[greater air elemental]] * {{brown|E}} [[greater earth elemental]] * {{red|E}} [[greater fire elemental]] * {{brightblue|E}} [[greater water elemental]] The four elementals from ''NetHack'' cannot [[grow up]] into their "greater" counterparts. Each set of elementals has a [[quest artifact]] that can be [[invoked]] to summon a tame elemental, including the artifacts carried over from SLASH'EM: * The [[Flame Mage]] quest artifact, [[The Candle of Eternal Flame]], for fire elementals * The [[Ice Mage]] quest artifact, [[The Storm Whistle]], for ice elementals (changed from SLASH'EM) * The [[Electric Mage]] quest artifact, [[The Harp of Lightning]], for air elementals * The [[Acid Mage]] quest artifact, [[The Flute of Slime]], for earth elementals * The [[Firefighter]] quest artifact, the [[Fire Chief Helmet]], for water elementals The invoke effects for the Acid and Electric Mage quest artifacts are based on the associations between particular elements in ''[[Dungeons & Dragons]]''. Each invoke effect {{frac|3|4}} chance of generating a standard elemental of that type and a {{frac|4}} chance of generating a greater elemental - for The Storm Whistle, it instead has a {{frac|4}} chance of creating an ice elemental, and will otherwise create an [[ice vortex]]. ==Encyclopedia entry== {{encyclopedia| Elementals are manifestations of the basic nature of the universe. Some mystics have postulated the necessity for a fifth type, the spirit elemental, but none have ever been encountered, at least on this plane of existence. }} ==References== {{nethack-367}} [[Category:Monster classes]]
